page.title: 15Traffic Survey (contd)
page.content: The{A6 to London}carried the{most traffic: { Cars}217,{Lorries}192,{Coaches}12 {TOTAL 421 vehicles. The{A405 to Hatfield}and the{North carried{less}traffic: { Cars} 99,{Lorries}109,{Coaches} 2 {TOTAL 210 vehicles. {London Road}(A6 to St. Albans) carried the{least}amount of traffic: { Cars }29,{Lorries} 10,{Coaches} 0 {TOTAL 39 vehicles. {GRAND TOTALS { Cars 345, Lorries 311, Coaches 14. The A6 took the greatest amount of traffic because it is a major road going from Leicester to London. There are many lorries going down the A6 dropping off and picking up loads. Coaches frequently travel to and from London on the A6.
